reading_texts.title: Reading Passage 1
reading_texts.content: The internet has significant advantages for many students. It is very common to see people undertaking university courses spending a considerable amount of time in front of a computer either at home or in the library. Even before university age, younger students, often with parental encouragement, are using the internet at home.

reading_texts.title: Reading Passage 2
reading_texts.content: There is, of course, a clear argument to be made for advocating a complete ban on private ownership of firearms even if they are intended for protection. There is a significant risk of accidentally discharging the weapon, or using it in a moment of anger, resulting in injury or death that could not have occurred if the weapon had been banned. There are numerous cases where children, finding a weapon in the house, have used it with deadly consequence when only intending to use it as a toy.

reading_texts.title: Reading Passage 3
reading_texts.content: In recent years, concerns have arisen over the diet of younger children. Many products have significant quantities of sugar, preservatives and artificial additives, and the connection between the intake of such foods and subsequent behaviour is becoming increasingly apparent. A clear example can be seen in the number of hours children are allowed to stay indoors, forsaking more traditional activities for computer games and television programmes.
